title: Any great figurative logos come to mind?
content:
Hi all,

I'm starting to do a peer review of logos that feature the human form.

Anything memorable come to mind?

The company I'm working with is a handyman who is looking to make a move to becoming a builder/contractor.

Thanks in advance!

--new2me
author: new2me

comments.content: Logolounge.com and the books have sections specific to this. I don't think Logopond does however.

[http://www.identityarchives.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090546/http:/www.identityarchives.com/ "http://www.identityarchives.com/") has a search tool based on keywords. They don't have a huge database yet, but it's growing.

There's a search at [http://www.brandsoftheworld.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090546/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/ "http://www.brandsoftheworld.com") (but it's based on the name of the logo.) At least you get a scalable EPS to work with from them.

For retro logos with caricatures these books are pretty good:

[Character Trademarks](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090546/http:/www.amazon.com/Character-Trademarks-John-Mendenhall/dp/B000IOEMJ8/sr=8-13/qid=1167331437/ref=sr_1_13/105-0140738-7842847?ie=UTF8&s=books)

[British Trademarks](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090546/http:/www.amazon.com/British-Trademarks-20s-John-Mendenhall/dp/0877015775/sr=8-19/qid=1167331545/ref=sr_1_19/105-0140738-7842847?ie=UTF8&s=books)

I have them both - he has other trademark compilations.

peace
